Package ss.pentago.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.model.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutomatedGame
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game holds the two Player objects and the Board. It provides methods for updating and querying the game board, and querying the players.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Board board  
      protected int current
      Index of the current player.
      protected Player[] players
      The 2 players of the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(Player s0, Player s1)
      Creates a new Game object, and sets the players marbles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Board getBoard()
      Get the Board associated with this game.
      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Get the player who's turn it currently is.
      Player getFirstPlayer()
      Get the first player.
      Player getSecondPlayer()
      Get the second player.
      Player getWinningPlayer()
      Get the winning player.
      boolean isDraw()
      Check whether the game ended in a draw.
      boolean isGameOver()
      Check whether the game is over.
      void shuffle()
      Meant to be used after calling the constructor, to shuffle the players.
      void update​(int position)
      Updates the board by placing the current player's marble.
      boolean update​(Move move)
      Updates the board by placing the current player's marble and rotating a sub board, and switches to the next player.

      Updates the board by rotating a sub board, and switches to the next player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(Player s0,
            Player s1)
        Creates a new Game object, and sets the players marbles. By default, the first player supplied is the starting player. Call shuffle() to randomize the starting player.
        Parameters:
        s0 - the first player
        s1 - the second player

    • Method Detail

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Meant to be used after calling the constructor, to shuffle the players.

      • update

        public void update​(int position)
            throws BoardPositionException
        Updates the board by placing the current player's marble.
        Parameters:
        position - the position index
        Throws:
        BoardPositionException - when the position is out of range or already occupied

      • update

        public boolean update​(Rotation rotation)
        Updates the board by rotating a sub board, and switches to the next player.
        Parameters:
        rotation - the rotation
        Returns:
        true if board so far resulted in a game over, false otherwise

      • update

        public boolean update​(Move move)
               throws BoardPositionException
        Updates the board by placing the current player's marble and rotating a sub board, and switches to the next player. This is a convenience method that combines updating the board with the position and with the rotation.
        Parameters:
        move - the move
        Returns:
        true if move resulted in a game over, false otherwise
        Throws:
        BoardPositionException - when the position is out of range or already occupied

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Check whether the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if game over, false otherwise

      • isDraw

        public boolean isDraw()
        Check whether the game ended in a draw.
        Returns:
        true if a draw, false otherwise

      • getWinningPlayer

        public Player getWinningPlayer()
        Get the winning player.
        Returns:
        null if no player won due to a draw or because the game is not over yet, the first player, respectively, the second player, if they alone won

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Get the Board associated with this game.
        Returns:
        the board

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Get the player who's turn it currently is.
        Returns:
        the current player

        Returns:
        the first player

      • getSecondPlayer

        public Player getSecondPlayer()
        Get the second player.
        Returns:
        the second player
